article: It was a cold winter s night when I stopped for gas on my way home from work. I was tired and had a slight _ .I worked in a _ doctor s office and this was one of those days when the unexpected happened, making the schedule run _ than usual. It seemed I was going to be late _ home and my husband, being the _ person, would be ready to pronounce me late once again. Maybe _ I hurried, I could still make it home.I was heading inside to _ for my gas when I noticed an older couple at the counter. I heard them asking for _ to the local hospital. It was the same hospital that I had just _ a few minutes ago.The young man at the counter was trying to be _ in explaining how to get there, with two other people making _ . One of them was _ trying to give them a whole different route back. It was then that I walked over to the couple and said, Would you like to follow me to the _ ? A look of _ crossed the woman s face. I m going right by there, I said, which wasn t a(an) _ since I had just made up my mind to do _ that.I got in my car and began the journey back. I was trying to watch to be sure they were right _ me. It took only fifteen minutes to get there as rush hour traffic was beginning to _ . I felt better than I had all day and my headache was nearly gone.Later, as I arrived home, my husband _ , So you aren t ever late any more. I said, Sometimes it s _ to be late.
